section.title: Overview
section.para: This page will show you how to create and use String objects. Stings are useful for storing characters as a set. One possible use of them is to report back a specific message at a set point in the mission sequence.

section.title: Listing of Objects and Commands that interact

listitem.para: You may add a string to the Parameter List in the Report Object dialog box via the ParameterSelectDialog box.
Alternatively, you may add a string to the Parameter List in the Report Command dialog box

section.title: Using the GUI
section.para: A string's value may be set at its creation or later by editing it by double clicking on it in the Resource tree. The dialog box for creating a String may be used to create many at once while defining their values if you choose.

listitem.para: Press this button after giving a name to a string. You may also define its value in the Value field before creating it if you wish.
You can define the name of the String here.
You can define the value of the String here.
This is where the strings you have previously created will appear. They appear here once you click the Create button.
